security: This document details the Agency's assessment of RABEL's loyalties and potential double agent status. It questions whether RABEL betrayed the AMTRUNK Operation and acknowledges accusations that he was a CASTRO agent. Directly quoting: 'Without postulating this sort of dual role... it is almost impossible to explain some of the reasonably good things he did for the Agency and the quite certain allegations that he was a CASTRO agent.' Disclosing these details could reveal intelligence methodologies and compromise sources.
summary: This memorandum discusses Jose Ricardo RABEL Nunez (AMLEO-3), assessing his background, potential dual loyalties to both the CIA and CASTRO, and his involvement with the AMTRUNK Operation.
summary_one_paragraph: A CIA memorandum, dated January 14, 1977, analyzes Jose Ricardo RABEL Nunez (AMLEO-3), a Cuban exile, focusing on his possible double agent status and reliability. It details RABEL's background, including his U.S. Army service, involvement in anti-BATISTA activities, defection from Cuba, and work with the Agency's AMTRUNK Operation, while weighing accusations of his collaboration with CASTRO. The memo questions whether RABEL betrayed the AMTRUNK operation, highlighting the conflicting reports of his loyalties and the circumstances of his imprisonment and release in Cuba.
title: Jose Ricardo RABEL Nunez (AMLEO-3) (201-249386)
